moves to fix piped supply

title: Watch: Why some movies ‘Start at interval’ | The never-ending set-up problem | Kalki 2898 AD
description: Why do so many big films feel like they take forever to begin? In this episode of Frequently Made Mistakes, Sudheesh Kamat breaks down the danger of endless setup masquerading as drama, using Kal Ki 2898 AD as a case study. Drama isn’t information—it’s conflict under pressure. And without early conflict, stories lose urgency and audience investment.

History of India’s Union Budgets - Some Budgets that became blueprints for institutional change
description: Union Budgets are often treated as routine fiscal announcements, yet in recent four decades they have quietly reshaped taxation, regulation and economic policy. Why did finance ministers repeatedly use the Budget to dismantle the licence raj, build market institutions and enforce fiscal rules—and why does that legacy still shape India’s political economy today? The answers lie in how the Budget became a tool of structural reform.

description: Interspersed with verses from Kurunthogai of Sangam literature, Thevaram, Naalayira Divya Prabandham, and Bharati’s patriotic songs, the reading traced excerpts from The Tamils by Nirmala Lakshman covering the Pallava, Pandya, Chola, and Chera dynasties, followed by the Marathas, Christendom, and the contributions of the Muslim community to Tamil culture The Tamils by Nirmala Lakshman: A Theatrical Reading by Artists - Anita Ratnam, Nandhini Subbulakshmi, Revathy Kumar, Sarvesh Sridhar, and Tehzeeb Katari Edited and Directed by Prasanna Ramaswamy

title: Pongal restored to ‘factory settings’
description: In urbania, Pongal is often a mere holiday providing respite from the everyday grind. At some corporate houses, usually one day in advance, the marbled aisle between banks of cubicles would sport the boiling rice pot and host traditional games that go link-armed with the harvest festival. For the 9to5ers, this is an act of symbolism, one designed to strengthen their bonds with teammates. Here are two corporate professionals from Chennai who decided to go in for the real McCoy — having all of these festivities in its original settings, on the earthen path with stubbles of grass separating paddy fields. For them, this is an act of gratitude, one that renews their bond with the land where they grow their own food. Treading separate paths, these two represent a growing tribe among the urbane that seeks greater purpose by pausing the bustle, if not muting it entirely

title: Pollution crisis: GRAP-IV reimposed in Delhi-NCR; air quality slips to ‘severe’ category
description: Delhi-NCR's air quality has plunged into the 'severe' category, prompting the Commission for Air Quality Management to reimpose GRAP-IV restrictions. This escalation follows the earlier enforcement of GRAP-III.  Under Stage IV, older vehicles like BS-III petrol and BS-IV diesel models are banned from plying, with exceptions for essential services.  Existing GRAP measures remain in effect.

description: Steve Smith's tactical decision to deny Babar Azam a single during a crucial power surge ultimately paid off as Smith smashed a record-breaking 32 runs in the subsequent over. Despite Babar's visible frustration, Smith's aggressive batting secured a five-wicket win for the Sydney Sixers, with Smith going on to score a century.

JEE Main 2026 admit card released: Check direct link, how to access session 1 hall ticket here
description: The National Testing Agency has released the JEE Main 2026 January session admit card on its official website. Candidates can download their hall tickets using their application number and date of birth. The January session exams are scheduled from January 21 to January 29, 2026, with the second session in April.

Beyond the badge: The unseen burden of independent Indian women
description: Modern Indian women are celebrated as independent, yet this often masks exhaustion from constant negotiation and performance.  Once a thrilling discovery, independence now carries immense pressure, demanding visible strength and early responsibility.  This evolution highlights a generational truth: independence is expected early, learned through observing the sacrifices of others, and often met with criticism.

BBL: Embarrassment for Pakistan; Babar, Rizwan top unwanted list
description: Pakistan stars Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan endured a tough BBL 2026, topping the list of the slowest batters with strike rates of 107.48 and 102.74. Babar’s frustration was visible after a mid-pitch clash with Steve Smith, before his dismissal. Rizwan, meanwhile, became the first overseas player in BBL history to be retired out, highlighting concerns over their T20 tempo.

title: Side hustle ends a Google career: Why this Bengaluru engineer was forced to quit
description: The resignation of Google engineer Arpit Bhayani over his educational side work has become a symbol of a deeper shift in India’s tech workforce. As freelancing surges and moonlighting checks tighten, companies and employees are drifting out of sync. The story reflects a growing tension between rigid corporate rules and a workforce that has quietly embraced flexible, parallel careers.

title: 'Axar is way ahead of Jadeja': Ex-India cricketer's blunt verdict
description: Ravindra Jadeja's ODI form is under scrutiny due to quiet performances with bat and ball, with recent numbers raising questions. Mohammad Kaif believes Axar Patel is a superior option in white-ball cricket, citing batting prowess and bowling versatility. Kaif also questioned team selection, advocating for Axar's inclusion over Nitish Kumar Reddy for better balance.

title: 'BJP won polls by betrayal': Uddhav's 1st address after BMC drubbing, says 'battle not over'
description: Following BMC election results, Uddhav Thackeray asserted Shiv Sena (UBT) remains strong despite BJP's alleged betrayal and attempts to buy loyalty. The Thackeray-led alliance secured significant wins in Mumbai's Marathi heartland, though they lost control of the BMC after nearly three decades to the Mahayuti alliance.

description: The Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray) and Raj Thackeray's Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) combine had framed the BMC polls as a battle to “save the Marathi manoos and Mumbai, projecting the contest as both an assertion of regional pride and a referendum on the Thackeray legacy. ​The reunion of Uddhav Thackeray and Raj Thackeray after nearly two decades was billed as an acid test for the Thackeray brand.

title: Pune on my plate: How 2 iconic Mumbai kebab places have found patronage in Pune
Peanut lodged in the lung, oxygen at 40%: Two infants narrowly escape death in Faridabad
description: Two Faridabad infants narrowly escaped death after accidentally inhaling food particles, leading to critical respiratory failure. Doctors at Amrita Hospital performed emergency procedures, removing a peanut from one-year-old's airway and using advanced cryotherapy for an eight-month-old's lodged object. Timely, specialized intervention saved both lives, highlighting the dangers of foreign body aspiration in infants.

'Asli poriborton': PM Modi says TMC converting 'infiltrators into voters' in Bengal - what he said
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed a rally in Malda, West Bengal, advocating for "asli poribortan" and criticizing the Mamata Banerjee-led Trinamool Congress. He highlighted BJP's recent poll victories in Bihar, Odisha, and Assam, stating these states have been freed from "divisive politics." Modi expressed confidence in Bengal's "urge for real change" to achieve a developed India by 2047.

24 is panicking, 34 is exhausted: The fears of young India in 2026
description: India's youth, comprising millennials and Gen Z, face distinct anxieties shaped by differing political, economic, and technological landscapes. While millennials fear instability after years of effort, Gen Z grapples with the prospect of never achieving stability. Both generations navigate concerns over job security, economic inequality, and climate change, highlighting a cautious outlook on their future.

title: Delhi: NRI doctors duped of Rs 15cr; how ‘digital arrest’ kept couple trapped
description: Three individuals have been apprehended in connection with the Rs 15 crore "digital arrest" of an NRI doctor couple in Delhi. The accused, including two who provided bank accounts and one facilitator, are being investigated for links to China- and Cambodia-based scammers.  Significant portions of the defrauded money were channeled through various business entities.

Stephen Curry pens 'keep shooting' for Klay Thompson's 3-point mark
description: Klay Thompson has officially become the NBA's fourth all-time leader in three-pointers, surpassing Damian Lillard with 2,805 made.  This remarkable achievement, despite past injuries, drew praise from former teammate Stephen Curry.  The duo, once a legendary backcourt, continues to share mutual respect and support even after Thompson's move to Dallas.

title: ‘No entry for non-Hindus’: Har ki Pauri boards cite century-old bylaw; officials say no fresh order
description: New notice boards citing a century-old bylaw restricting non-Hindus at Har-ki-Pauri have been installed by the Ganga Sabha. The body aims to enforce rules framed in 1916, stating only those connected to Sanatan Dharma should enter the holy site. While the Ganga Sabha seeks wider implementation, district officials emphasize that enforcement depends on civic authorities and adherence to the law.

title: 'Negative': Why MrBeast 'cannot buy McDonald’s' despite $5 bn company valuation
Steelers nation demands change after Tomlin's steelers exit
description: Steelers Nation has accepted Mike Tomlin's departure after nearly two decades, with a poll showing 64.79% of fans believing it was the right decision. While acknowledging his past success and Super Bowl title, fans expressed frustration with recent playoff disappointments and conservative play-calling. Tomlin is reportedly considering a move to television.

title: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt's heartfelt life update amid team's tough season
description: The Kansas City Chiefs had a pretty disappointing season this time, but the billionaire heiress, Gracie Hunt, has always been there for the team. Amid all the mess, Gracie Hunt has made a wholesome post about her life along with a few inspirational words that has moved fans. With the team's poor performance, many of their players are also getting trolled brutally.

title: Zuckerberg hired Wang for $14bn — now they’re clashing
description: Meta's new structure reveals tension between Mark Zuckerberg and Alexandr Wang, the $14 billion AI recruit. Wang finds Zuckerberg's micromanagement stifling, while staff question his leadership for Meta's AI ambitions. A recent strategy clash highlighted differing priorities, with Wang pushing for cutting-edge AI over immediate product integration.

title: Kevin O’Leary’s warning for US on China: America lacks grid for AI surge; China adds 500 GW
description: Kevin O'Leary, a prominent Canadian investor, voices a concerning warning about the AI surge in America: it's on a collision course with an energy crisis. He points out that while China's energy infrastructure is evolving rapidly—with an impressive addition of 500 gigawatts—the U.S. has shockingly added 'zero.
